docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14. -- Welcomed by Secretaries Roper and Wallace "in a genuinely friendly spirit," eleven aviation leaders from as many Latin-American countries expressed amazement today at the picture of modern aviation which Eugene I. Vidal,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14. -- Welcomed by Secretaries Roper and Wallace "in a genuinely friendly spirit," eleven aviation leaders from as many Latin-American countries expressed amazement today at the picture of modern aviation which Eugene I. Vidal, director of air commerce, and his assistants drew for them from charts, figures and actual demonstration of new aids to navigation.

headline.main: OUR AIR PROGRESS SHOWN TO VISITORS; Washington Officials Are Hosts to Eleven Air Officials From Latin-American Countries. FRIENDLY SPIRIT PRAISED Roper Welcomes Party -- Wallace Tells of Weather-Signal Aids -- New Equipment Studied.

headline.main: 350 More Off to Fight for Italy.

docs.snippet: Difficulties arising from Germany's use of blocked funds in her Latin-American trade are being reduced by the action of the nations themselves, Harry Tipper, executive vice president of the American Manufacturers Export Association, said yesterday in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Difficulties arising from Germany's use of blocked funds in her Latin-American trade are being reduced by the action of the nations themselves, Harry Tipper, executive vice president of the American Manufacturers Export Association, said yesterday in commenting upon a survey of exchange conditions conducted by his group.
docs.abstract: On use of German blocked marks in Latin-Amer trade

headline.main: BAN BLOCKED MARKS IN LATIN AMERICA; Many Difficulties Overcome by Action, Exporters Says, in Exchange Report.

docs.snippet: Credit and collections conditions in Latin America held the gains registered earlier in the year, according to the quarterly survey of twenty-one South and Central American countries completed yesterday by the foreign department of the National...
docs.lead_paragraph: Credit and collections conditions in Latin America held the gains registered earlier in the year, according to the quarterly survey of twenty-one South and Central American countries completed yesterday by the foreign department of the National Association of Credit Men.
docs.abstract: survey of credits and collections by Natl Assn of Credit Men

headline.main: COLLECTIONS STEADY IN SOUTH AMERICA; Gains Registered in Many Nations Offset by Losses in Others, Credit Group Reports.

docs.snippet: Faced with increasingly aggressive competition from Europe, all American international air mail, passenger and express service to Latin America will be put on new high-speed schedules, averaging nearly 150 miles an hour, on Nov. 1, Juan T. Trippe,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Faced with increasingly aggressive competition from Europe, all American international air mail, passenger and express service to Latin America will be put on new high-speed schedules, averaging nearly 150 miles an hour, on Nov. 1, Juan T. Trippe, president of Pan American Airways, disclosed yesterday.
docs.abstract: service to Latin Amer to be placed on high-speed schedules Nov 1

headline.main: AIRLINE SPEEDED TO LATIN AMERICA; Fleet of Thirty New Planes Soon Will Be Used to Meet Europe's Competition.

docs.snippet: Business in the foreign exchange market last week, dictated by the war news, developed a firm tone on Saturday in response to the halt in the crisis initiated by England's offer to withdraw part of her naval armament'. A similar measure of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Business in the foreign exchange market last week, dictated by the war news, developed a firm tone on Saturday in response to the halt in the crisis initiated by England's offer to withdraw part of her naval armament'. A similar measure of cooperation on the part of Italy is expected to finally dissipate the tension which has hovered over international markets for several months now.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED OCT. 19, 1935.
